sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Further weakness as Rapid7 (NASDAQ:RPD) drops 5.0% this week, taking three-year losses to 29%
feed.summary: Rapid7 Inc. (NASDAQ:RPD) shares have fallen 5.0% this past week, contributing to a 29% loss over the last three years, underperforming the market, despite impressive revenue growth of 22% per year over the same period. While the company is not yet profitable, its strong revenue growth might indicate a potential buying opportunity for investors who believe the previous share price may have overvalued future growth. Analysts have provided forecasts, suggesting investors should review consensus estimates for future profit levels.

feed.title: Ready Capital Corp Reports Mixed Q4 Results Amid Real Estate Sec
feed.summary: Ready Capital Corp (RC) reported mixed Q4 2023 results, with GAAP earnings per share of $0.12 and distributable earnings per share of $0.26, amidst challenges in the commercial real estate sector. The company achieved a net income of $10.88 million and saw total assets increase to $12.44 billion, while strategically avoiding office collateral to mitigate market risks. Despite sector headwinds, Ready Capital declared a dividend of $0.30 per common share, reflecting resilience and a focus on core lending strategies.

feed.title: MUFG continues to strategically invest in Leveraged Credit business with key new hire
feed.summary: MUFG has strengthened its Leveraged Credit business with the addition of Jordan Hollander as a Director on the High Yield Credit Research team. Hollander brings extensive experience from both the buy-side and sell-side, previously working at Legal & General Investment Management, Deutsche Bank, and Jefferies. This strategic hire, along with recent appointments to the Leveraged Credit Distribution team, underscores MUFG's commitment to expanding its capabilities in sales and trading to better serve its issuer and investor clients.

feed.title: Marcus & Millichap Brokers $9.8M Sale of Shopping Center in Hampton, Georgia
feed.summary: Marcus & Millichap has brokered the $9.8 million sale of Centre at Lovejoy, a 46,700-square-foot shopping center in Hampton, Georgia. The property was sold by WRS Inc. to New York-based AGW Partners and was part of a larger two-property portfolio sale. Centre at Lovejoy is shadow-anchored by Walmart and was 100% leased to 17 tenants, including Bank of America, GameStop, and Dollar Tree at the time of sale.

feed.title: McDonald's evolution from drive-in to global fast-food icon
feed.summary: This article chronicles the transformation of McDonald's from its beginnings as a drive-in restaurant founded by the McDonald brothers in 1940 to its current status as a global fast-food empire. It highlights key milestones such as the introduction of the "Speedee Service System," Ray Kroc's involvement in franchising, and the development of its iconic design and menu items like the Big Mac and Happy Meal. Today, McDonald's operates in 119 countries with over 35,000 restaurants, continuing to innovate, as evidenced by its new spin-off, CosMc's.

feed.title: JLL’s Capital Markets team completes sale of 216,000 SF 8A industrial warehouse
feed.summary: JLL Capital Markets has successfully arranged the sale of a 216,000-square-foot industrial warehouse at 152 Ridge Road in South Brunswick Township, New Jersey, to Invesco Real Estate. The property, fully leased to a third-party logistics company, is located in the strong-performing Exit 8A market. JLL's team highlighted the continued demand, rent growth, and absorption rates in the New Jersey industrial market.

feed.title: Michigan Strategic Fund board OKs incentives for solar component site in Saginaw County
feed.summary: The Michigan Strategic Fund board has approved significant incentives for Corning Inc. to build a $900 million solar component manufacturing facility in Saginaw County, Michigan. This project is expected to create 1,151 jobs with competitive wages and benefits and is a key step in strengthening the domestic solar supply chain. Corning chose Michigan due to its local workforce and proximity to Hemlock Semiconductor, despite offers from other states.

feed.title: Boss Energy expands global uranium footprint with Alta Mesa project
feed.summary: Boss Energy (ASX: BOE) has completed a $92 million acquisition of a 30% stake in the Alta Mesa in situ recovery (ISR) uranium project in South Texas from enCore Energy, marking a significant step in its global expansion. This move diversifies Boss Energy's production geographically and adds to its growing uranium inventory, complementing its Honeymoon uranium project in South Australia. The Alta Mesa project has a central processing plant with a capacity of 1.5 million pounds of uranium per year and historically produced nearly 5Mlb of uranium.

feed.title: News | Starwood Capital Recruits Blackstone Executive as President
feed.summary: Starwood Capital Group has appointed Jonathan Pollack, formerly Blackstone's global head of Real Estate Credit (BREDS), as its new president. He will join Starwood's executive leadership team in early 2025, taking over from Jeffrey G. Dishner, who will become vice chairman. This move highlights significant leadership changes happening within major private real estate investment firms, as Starwood Capital prepares for its next phase of growth.

feed.title: A Look At Dynex Capital’s (DX) Valuation Following The Recent CFO Transition
feed.summary: Dynex Capital (DX) recently announced a CFO transition, appointing Michael Sartori. The company's stock shows a mixed performance with a 17.77% one-year return but a 4.82% decline in the last 30 days. Despite strong recent earnings growth and a P/E ratio of 12.1x, the stock appears overvalued based on discounted cash flow models and trades at a premium compared to industry peers, suggesting a need for careful consideration by investors.

feed.title: Will J.B. Hunt’s Financing Flexibility and Intermodal Streak Reshape J.B. Hunt Transport Services' (JBHT) Narrative
feed.summary: J.B. Hunt Transport Services (JBHT) recently filed an omnibus shelf registration for financing flexibility and was named the best domestic intermodal provider for the sixth consecutive time. This combination suggests strong operational execution paired with capital-market optionality, potentially influencing its investment narrative and long-term earnings. While the company projects significant revenue and earnings growth by 2028, analysts caution about the risk of inflation eroding cost savings and present diverse fair value estimates.

feed.title: A Look At Fair Isaac (FICO) Valuation As New Mortgage Score Simulator Draws Attention
feed.summary: Fair Isaac (FICO) is back in focus with the launch of its new Mortgage Score Simulator, a tool for subscribers to test the impact of credit moves on FICO scores. While the stock has seen short-term volatility, its long-term shareholder returns remain strong. The article discusses FICO's valuation, noting it is considered 31.4% undervalued by one narrative based on future cash flows, but its P/E ratio is significantly higher than industry averages, signaling potential valuation risk.

feed.title: Applied Materials Highlights Supplier Awards As AI Demand And Valuation Scrutinized
feed.summary: Applied Materials recognized 12 suppliers with excellence awards, emphasizing quality, service, and sustainability in its supply chain, crucial for supporting AI-driven semiconductor demand. While the stock has seen significant short-term momentum and trades below analyst targets, Simply Wall St's valuation model suggests it's currently overvalued. Investors should consider the company's strategic supplier partnerships, financial metrics, and recent insider selling.

feed.title: Reassessing Arista Networks (ANET) After Strong Multi Year Gains And Recent Pullback
feed.summary: This article reassesses Arista Networks (ANET) after significant multi-year gains and recent pullbacks, noting its role in data center and cloud networking. Using DCF analysis, the stock appears undervalued by 14.6%, but based on its P/E ratio compared to a proprietary "Fair Ratio," it screens as overvalued. The article also presents "Narratives" with bull and bear cases, showing how different assumptions lead to varying fair value conclusions for ANET.

feed.title: Zacks Industry Outlook Highlights Marriott International, Hilton Worldwide and Hyatt Hotels
feed.summary: The Zacks Hotels and Motels industry faces ongoing challenges including sticky inflation, high operating costs, and economic uncertainty, impacting profitability despite a projected gradual improvement from 2026. The industry's poor Zacks Industry Rank reflects a negative earnings outlook, yet companies like Marriott International, Hilton Worldwide, and Hyatt Hotels are pursuing growth strategies such as portfolio expansion, conversions, and leveraging digitalization to navigate these headwinds. The article highlights these three companies as stocks to watch due to their specific growth initiatives and positive earnings forecasts despite the broader industry's struggles.

feed.title: Ventas (NYSE:VTR) Sets New 52-Week High - Should You Buy?
feed.summary: Ventas (NYSE:VTR) reached a new 52-week high of $87.87 during recent trading, with significant analyst attention leading to an average "Moderate Buy" rating and a consensus price target of $86.87. The company recently increased its quarterly dividend to $0.52 per share and has a market capitalization of $41.14 billion. Despite missing earnings estimates in its last quarterly report, institutional investors have shown increased interest, with Vanguard Group Inc. significantly boosting its stake.

feed.title: Amgen Nears a Nivolumab Biosimilar Milestone in Melanoma: What Investors Should Watch
feed.summary: Amgen's Phase 3 study for its ABP 206 drug, a nivolumab biosimilar for melanoma, has completed, signaling potential market entry. This development aims to provide a lower-cost alternative for high-risk melanoma treatment. A successful outcome could create a new revenue stream for Amgen and potentially increase access for patients, while also putting pricing pressure on existing immuno-oncology drugs like OPDIVO.

feed.title: Texas Pacific Land (NYSE:TPL) Director Donna Epps Buys 895 Shares
feed.summary: Texas Pacific Land (NYSE:TPL) Director Donna Epps recently purchased 895 shares of the company's stock for $456,852.75, increasing her total ownership to 2,921 shares valued at approximately $1.49 million. This insider transaction comes as Texas Pacific Land reported stronger-than-expected earnings and increased its quarterly dividend. The company's stock is trading up, and KeyCorp raised its price target to $639 while the consensus rating remains "Hold."

feed.title: Albemarle Corporation Plans Quarterly Dividend of $0.41 (NYSE:ALB)
feed.summary: Albemarle Corporation (NYSE:ALB) declared a quarterly dividend of $0.405 per share, payable on April 1st to shareholders of record by March 13th, representing an annualized dividend of $1.62 and a 0.9% yield. Despite a current payout ratio of 216% due to recent negative earnings, analysts project earnings per share of $1.91 next year, which would result in a more sustainable payout ratio of 84.8%. The company has consistently increased its dividend for the past 30 years and recently reported a revenue beat but an EPS miss for its latest quarter.

feed.title: Everest Group, Ltd. (NYSE:EG) to Issue $2.00 Quarterly Dividend
feed.summary: Everest Group, Ltd. (NYSE:EG) has declared a quarterly dividend of $2.00 per share, amounting to an annualized dividend of $8.00 with a 2.4% yield. The dividend has an ex-dividend date of March 13th and will be paid on March 27th to shareholders of record. The dividend appears sustainable, supported by a historical payout ratio of 13.1% and expected future payout ratio of 12.8% based on analyst EPS projections.

feed.title: RBC Capital Adjusts Targa Resources Price Target to $260 From $218, Maintains Outperform Rating
feed.summary: RBC Capital has raised its price target for Targa Resources (TRGP) to $260 from $218, while reiterating an Outperform rating on the stock. This adjustment reflects a positive outlook on the company's performance and prospects. The article also mentions other analysts recently adjusting their price targets for Targa Resources, generally with a positive inclination.

feed.title: Deere Shareholders Reelect Board and Approve Executive Pay
feed.summary: Deere & Company shareholders re-elected all director nominees and approved executive compensation at their February 25, 2026 annual meeting, demonstrating continued support for the company's leadership and strategic direction. Deloitte & Touche LLP was also ratified as the independent auditor for the 2026 fiscal year. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates DE as Neutral, citing solid profitability and guidance upgrades alongside balance-sheet leverage and demanding valuation.

feed.title: Deere shareholders elect board, approve pay, and ratify auditor at annual meeting
feed.summary: Deere & Company shareholders recently held their annual meeting, electing all nominated directors, approving executive compensation on an advisory basis, and ratifying Deloitte & Touche LLP as their independent auditor for the 2026 fiscal year. Three shareholder proposals were not approved. The company, trading at a P/E ratio of 35.16, has maintained dividend payments for 55 consecutive years, with analysts offering mixed but generally positive outlooks, including raised price targets from DA Davidson, Morgan Stanley, and UBS, though Jefferies downgraded due to valuation concerns.

feed.title: CarMax (KMX) Integrates Car Shopping in ChatGPT App Store
feed.summary: CarMax (KMX) has become the first U.S. auto retailer to integrate a car shopping app into the ChatGPT app store, allowing users to search for vehicles and access valuation information directly. While this innovation enhances customer engagement, the company's financial health presents a mixed picture with declining revenue growth and high leverage, despite strong free cash flow. Investors are advised to consider these factors, including a high debt-to-equity ratio and an Altman Z-Score indicating potential distress, alongside its marketing advancements.

feed.title: Tricolor Noteholders Sue JPMorgan, Barclays and Fifth Third
feed.summary: Tricolor noteholders have filed a lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase & Co., Barclays Plc, and Fifth Third Bancorp, alleging the banks facilitated a fraud at the now-bankrupt used-car dealer and lender. The lawsuit, filed by investment firms including One William Street Capital Management and Janus Henderson Group Plc, claims the plaintiffs collectively hold over $230 million in Tricolor notes.

feed.title: Hot Picks: Corteva, Mosaic, Eastman seen as undervalued in materials
feed.summary: Morningstar senior equity analyst Seth Goldstein identifies Corteva, Mosaic, and Eastman Chemical as undervalued opportunities in the basic materials sector. He highlights Corteva's planned separation of its seed and crop protection businesses, Mosaic's expected cost reductions and profit growth, and Eastman Chemical's strong balance sheet and secure dividend despite cyclical demand lows. These companies are poised for recovery with improving production, stable pricing, and an eventual rebound in demand.

feed.title: Teledyne And M Subs Announce Strategic Collaboration
feed.summary: Teledyne Marine and M Subs have signed an MOU to form a strategic collaboration focused on maritime unmanned systems. This partnership will leverage their combined expertise to develop solutions for the UK Royal Navy and other international naval programs, integrating advanced technologies like sonars, autonomy systems, and vehicle platforms. Efforts are already underway, including the successful integration of Teledyne SeaBat multibeam sonars on Zero USV platforms and planned deployments of Slocum gliders and Osprey class AUVs.

feed.title: CarMax launches ChatGPT app to personalize car shopping (KMX:NYSE)
feed.summary: CarMax (KMX) announced the launch of a new app in the ChatGPT app store aimed at personalizing the car shopping experience. This AI-powered search engine allows customers to conduct more tailored searches for vehicles. The news led to a positive movement in CarMax's shares.

feed.title: BlackRock’s GIP, EQT close to acquiring AES Corp, Bloomberg News reports
feed.summary: Bloomberg News has reported that BlackRock-owned Global Infrastructure Partners (GIP) and equity firm EQT AB are in advanced talks to acquire U.S.-based utility AES Corp. This potential acquisition comes as data-center demand increases strain on electrical grids, highlighting a growing need for reliable power generation. AES shares rose 5% on the news and the company has a market value of approximately $11.57 billion.

feed.title: MetLife Inc (MET) Shares Gap Down to $72.83 on Feb 27
feed.summary: MetLife Inc (MET) shares experienced a 4.10% gap down in mid-day trading on February 27th, settling at $72.83 after an intraday low of $72.35. This places the stock significantly below its 52-week high but above its 52-week low. Wall Street analysts and GuruFocus estimates suggest an "Outperform" status with a potential upside, indicating that the stock may be undervalued despite the recent dip.

feed.title: Lululemon Founder Chip Wilson Escalates Proxy Fight With Shareholder Letter
feed.summary: Lululemon Athletica founder Chip Wilson is intensifying his proxy fight with the company, pushing for significant changes to its board of directors. Wilson has escalated his efforts by sending a shareholder letter, signaling increased pressure on the Lululemon management.

feed.title: Report: Caesars Entertainment considering takeover offers
feed.summary: Caesars Entertainment is reportedly evaluating takeover offers, with billionaire Tilman Fertitta's company, Fertitta Entertainment, identified as one interested party. Potential scenarios also include a management-led buyout. Fertitta Entertainment operates the Golden Nugget casino-hotel chain, and Fertitta holds a significant stake in Wynn Resorts.

feed.title: HP Inc. earnings point to memory inflation challenge
feed.summary: HP Inc.'s recent earnings report indicates that surging DRAM and NAND memory costs, exacerbated by US trade regulations, are significantly impacting profit margins despite a rise in PC revenue and unit shipments. Memory now constitutes about 35% of a PC's bill of materials, doubling its previous weight and pressuring operating income. This shift creates both challenges for ITAD providers and opportunities for those controlling secondary component supply, potentially catalyzing a strategic move towards component-level recovery and remarketing.

feed.title: The power of in-network care: quick facts across generations
feed.summary: Humana research indicates that 64% of Americans prefer in-network dentists, with a stronger preference among older generations. While preference decreases in younger demographics, a majority across all age groups still favor in-network providers. This highlights the importance of network participation in dental care selection.

feed.title: BlackRock Inc Stock Moved Down by 4.24% on Feb 27: What Investors Need To Know
feed.summary: BlackRock Inc. (BLK) stock fell by 4.24% on February 27, driven by a Rosen Law Firm investigation into alleged fiduciary duty breaches and significant insider selling by executives like Robert L. Goldstein and J. Richard Kushel. Macroeconomic factors, such as higher-than-expected US PPI data signaling persistent inflation and uncertainty surrounding the Federal Reserve's policies, also contributed to the decline. Institutional investors showed mixed sentiment, with some trimming their positions while others increased holdings, further impacting market perception.

feed.title: Bank of America Corp Stock Moved Down by 4.63% on Feb 27: A Full Analysis
feed.summary: Bank of America Corp (BAC) stock dropped by 4.63% on February 27, underperforming the Banking & Investment Services industry, primarily due to broader macroeconomic pressures and reassessments of credit risk in the financial sector. Investors are concerned about potential credit stress and the impact of U.S. tariff policy uncertainty, leading to a "risk-off" sentiment. Technical indicators suggest a sell signal, and the company also faces significant regulatory penalties and concerns regarding expense growth and proposed credit card interest rate caps.

feed.title: Domino's Pizza (DPZ) Boosts Dividend by 14.4%
feed.summary: Domino's Pizza (DPZ) recently increased its quarterly dividend by 14.4% to $1.99 per share, signaling a strong commitment to shareholder returns. The company, operating as the world's largest pizza chain with a highly franchised model, demonstrates robust financial health with consistent revenue growth and expanding margins, despite recent stock price fluctuations. Valuation metrics suggest potential undervaluation, making it an attractive prospect for investors, though insider selling and market volatility warrant consideration.

feed.title: 'The current results don't reflect where we think they can get to': Goldstein on Mosaic Co.
feed.summary: Seth Goldstein, a senior equity analyst at Morningstar, discussed his "Hot Picks" in basic materials with BNN Bloomberg. He specifically commented on Mosaic Co., stating that its current results do not fully reflect its potential. The article highlights an interview where Goldstein shared his investment insights on the company.

feed.title: UBS Adjusts Price Target on NetApp to $113 From $120, Maintains Neutral Rating
feed.summary: UBS has lowered its price target for NetApp (NTAP) to $113 from $120 while maintaining a Neutral rating on the stock. This adjustment comes amidst other analyst revisions for NetApp, with some trimming price targets due to potential margin pressures, and others adjusting targets based on recent earnings or forward guidance. The article also provides a brief overview of NetApp's business segments and recent financial news.

feed.title: Coca-Cola’s incoming CEO reveals his 3 key focus areas
feed.summary: Henrique Braun, Coca-Cola's incoming CEO, will take over on March 31st with three main priorities. These include attracting younger consumers by integrating marketing and sales, improving speed to market for new innovations by focusing on local consumer insights, and implementing a digital-first strategy across all operations, including AI integration. Braun emphasizes the need for continuous improvement despite the company's past successes.

feed.title: Chipotle Under Fire After $12 Burrito Photo Sparks Portion Size Backlash
feed.summary: Chipotle is facing fresh criticism over its portion sizes after a college student shared a photo of a notably small $12 burrito purchased in La Jolla, California. The customer expressed dismay, noting the burrito was barely palm-sized despite the cost, triggering a backlash on Reddit. This comes as Chipotle introduces new GLP-1 focused, smaller high-protein menu items and has indicated room for further price increases without impacting customer traffic.

feed.title: Autodesk Posts Q4 Beat On AECO Strength; Comps Get Tougher In FY27, Analysts Say
feed.summary: Autodesk (NASDAQ: ADSK) reported a strong fourth quarter, with revenues and earnings beating analyst expectations, primarily driven by its AECO division. While analysts noted robust growth in normalized revenue and billings, concerns were raised about tougher comparisons and dissipating transactional model tailwinds in fiscal year 2027. Despite these future challenges, analysts from DA Davidson, BTIG, and Rosenblatt Securities maintained Buy ratings, though some lowered price targets.

feed.title: Snap-on tool carts: Why pros pay premium for these rolling tanks
feed.summary: This article examines why professional mechanics in the US are willing to pay a premium for Snap-on tool carts, despite their high cost. It highlights the carts' legendary build quality, durability, smooth drawer action, and strong resale value as key factors. While acknowledging they are not value purchases for casual users, the article concludes that for full-time professionals, a Snap-on cart represents an investment in workflow efficiency and long-term reliability.

feed.title: How Do Investors Really Feel About Diamondback Energy Inc?
feed.summary: Diamondback Energy Inc.'s (NYSE: FANG) short interest has decreased by 3.26% since the last report, with 9.22 million shares sold short, representing 5.04% of its tradable shares. This reduction in short interest suggests a more bullish sentiment among investors. Compared to its peers, Diamondback Energy Inc. has less short interest on average, indicating a relatively favorable perception.

feed.title: Why 1 Analyst Thinks Arista Networks Stock Can Still Gain Over 50% This Year
feed.summary: Evercore ISI analyst Amit Daryanani has raised his price target for Arista Networks (ANET) to $200, the highest on Wall Street, implying over 50% upside, driven by the company's strong position in AI-driven data centers and hyperscale networking. Arista Networks reported robust fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results, with significant revenue and earnings growth, and continues to benefit from strong demand for cloud and AI networking solutions. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" consensus rating for ANET, with an average price target that suggests substantial upside potential.

feed.title: Brokers Suggest Investing in ConocoPhillips (COP): Read This Before Placing a Bet
feed.summary: This article discusses brokerage recommendations for ConocoPhillips (COP), noting it has an average brokerage recommendation (ABR) of 1.71, approximating between Strong Buy and Buy. However, it cautions against solely relying on these recommendations due to potential positive bias from brokerage firms. Instead, it suggests using tools like the Zacks Rank, which for ConocoPhillips is currently a #4 (Sell) due to declining earnings estimates, indicating investors should be wary despite the seemingly positive ABR.

feed.title: Should You Buy Costco Stock Ahead of Q2 Earnings Report?
feed.summary: Ahead of its Q2 fiscal 2026 earnings report on March 5, Costco is showing strong performance metrics, with analysts optimistic about revenue and EPS growth. The company's membership-driven model, competitive pricing, and expanding digital capabilities contribute to its potential for an earnings beat. Although Costco's stock trades at a premium valuation compared to peers, its fundamental strengths suggest a hold for existing investors, with potential new investors advised to wait for post-earnings clarity or a more attractive entry point.

feed.title: Why McKesson’s Wound Care Strategy Matters Now for US Homecare
feed.summary: McKesson's wound care offerings are strategically positioned to reshape how clinics and homecare teams in the US manage complex wounds. The company provides an integrated system of products, distribution, analytics, and education, aiming to simplify operations, lower risk, and standardize care across various settings. For B2B and homecare buyers, this approach focuses on operational efficiency, consistent supply, and cost-of-care management rather than breakthrough medical technology.

feed.title: Brokers Suggest Investing in Teradyne (TER): Read This Before Placing a Bet
feed.summary: This article evaluates Teradyne's (TER) investment potential based on Wall Street analyst recommendations and the Zacks Rank system. While Teradyne has an average brokerage recommendation of 1.65 (approximating Strong Buy), the article cautions against relying solely on these recommendations due to potential positive bias from brokerage firms. Instead, it suggests validating such recommendations with the Zacks Rank, which has identified Teradyne as a #1 (Strong Buy) due to recent positive earnings estimate revisions.

feed.title: Shareholders to get 1 Josh Gibson digital coin for every Datavault AI share
feed.summary: Datavault AI (NASDAQ: DVLT) has set March 9, 2026, as the record date and April 30, 2026, as the planned distribution date for a 1:1 dividend of the Josh Gibson Coin to eligible equity holders. The Josh Gibson Coins are described as non-financial digital collectibles for personal, non-commercial use, and do not confer equity, voting, dividend, or profit-sharing rights. The company's board retains the right to change or revoke the distribution dates before the actual distribution.
